official-title.#text:
To delay enrollment in qualified health plans in State or
		  Federally facilitated Exchanges until 1 year after final rules are published
		  establishing the verification and other procedures to be used to implement
		  section 1411 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and carrying out
		  sections 6055 and 6056 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
DEFECT Act (Delaying Enrollment in
			 Federal Exchanges to Certify Trust) of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
1321 of the Patient Protection and Affordable
			 Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1321

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) until 1 year after the date that there is
			 published in the Federal Register—

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law,
			 no individual may be enrolled in a qualified health plan offered through an
			 Exchange under

header.#text:
Delay enrollment in
			 qualified health plans in State or Federally facilitated Exchanges until 1 year
			 after publication of rules establishing ver­i­fi­ca­tion and other Exchange
			 procedures and carrying out coverage reporting requirements

text.#text:
a
			 final rule that establishes the verification and other procedures to be used to
			 implement

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1411

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
6056 of the Internal Revenue Code of
			 1986

text.#text:
a
			 final rule to carry out

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2789 IH: DEFECT Act (Delaying Enrollment in Federal Exchanges to Certify Trust) of 2013
